title: tread93
author: tread93
content: Why is it that Btalk search bar is slow as molasses? I make one search and the whole system is down for 10 minutes lol

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.created_time: October 18, 2023, 04:31:57 AMLast edit: October 19, 2023, 03:58:03 PM by Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: tread93 on October 18, 2023, 04:29:46 AMWhy is it that Btalk search bar is slow as molasses? I make one search and the whole system is down for 10 minutes lolAre you sure? It’s been a long time since I last used the forum search feature I normally use Ninjastic.space to search for things I’m interested in. And for this thread sake, I just did a search for three different random words using the forum search engine and I didn’t experience any time delay  Edit: I finally replicated the issue, it seems like it only happens when you press the “search button” more than once. I was asked to wait for 4 minutes 4 seconds but when I typed in my word and clicked “search” everything worked.

comments.body: Quote from: tread93 on October 18, 2023, 04:29:46 AMWhy is it that Btalk search bar is slow as molasses? But, I have been using the search bar myself for a long time do search for things that I know the search function of the forum will find without any doubt. I recommend you to use Google search engine to search for threads in the website because it'll be a pain in head to do that with the internal search engine of the forum.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Quote from: tread93 on October 18, 2023, 04:29:46 AMWhy is it that Btalk search bar is slow as molasses? I make one search and the whole system is down for 10 minutes lolBitcointalk search could be annoying when you are looking for information, but not for slowness when you search for anything. If yes, then there was no need to create a thread then..

comments.author: MusaMohamed
comments.body: It is general limit to restrict bots, data scrapers and prevent Ddos attacks.Quote from: theymos on February 12, 2015, 10:03:56 PMThe rules are the same as for humans. But keep in mind:- No one is allowed to access the site more often than once per second on average. (Somewhat higher burst accesses are OK.)Quote from: theymos on March 26, 2014, 11:17:45 PMThe maximum allowed bot request frequency is 1 request per second. Those IPs are now accessing pages at an average of 2.5 requests per second combined. If you continue exceeding the allowed request limit, we will continue banning your IPs.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Most times the system can sense it's a bot trying to operate so quickly and It's natural because I do experience it as well while searching for information that is very useful to me. So what I noticed is that next time while searching you don't have to be too fast although is very annoying to see such messages displayed.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: This is strange, perhaps you only have this problem due to slow internet or slow computer.Mostly I search and it does not take me a lot of time. Perhaps in rare cases when the internet is slow, the search may take a few extra minutes, but usually things are fine.I ran a random search as a test and it took less than 2 minutes to complete the search even though I got 5 pages of search results. looks good.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Yeah, when I was earlier using that search icon, I was still new here; that's the only time I mostly experienced such, and I believe the reason for such was because I was just a newbie, and newbies are not allowed to search things so quickly. You will have to wait for a few minutes.Although, now, anytime I try to use the search icon, it still delays, and what I have noticed is that when you don't correctly put in the keyword or topic you want to search for, then you are going to experience such delays, but if you accurately put in the right search word, then you wouldn't have to wait for so long before you get your search result.For example, if you search for "Bitcoin wallet," You might get a quick result, but if you search for something like, "I sold my land and some jewelry to buy Bitcoin," then you might not get your search result coming up soon. Yeah, it delays, but not up to 10 minutes like you said. It would rather tell you, "No result found."For me, ninjastic.space is more preferable, or you can also make use of the second search option, which is the one linked to Google.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: Cantsay on October 18, 2023, 04:31:57 AMI finally replicated the issue, it seems like it only happens when you press the “search button” more than once. I was asked to wait for 4 minutes but when I typed in my word and clicked “search” everything worked.Mmm...I don't know about that; the search function has always been pretty damn slow for me, and I did figure out early on that hitting the button more than once gives you the big ol' stop sign tread93 described.But that's not even the worst part of the forum's search functionality--the results you get are disorganized and it's been my experience that they rarely help me find what I'm looking for.  And yes I do know about the alternative way of using google to search, but Theymos really ought to fix stuff like this.  I don't mind the old-school look, but a broken search function is just bad.
